channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Here's what's different in the new spending legislation approved by the House
item.description: House lawmakers voted 366-34 to approve the bill.

item.title: DEI Is a Waste and Distraction at the University of Michigan
item.description: As the university begins to question the utility of DEI, some on campus may cling to it. They should be ignored.

item.title: Biden administration withdraws pending regulations on transgender athletes, student debt
item.description: President Joe Biden is abandoning his efforts to provide some protections for transgender student athletes and cancel student loans for more than 38 m...

item.title: New J6 Transcript Contradicts Hutchinson’s Claims Trump Went Grand Theft Auto
item.description: Lawmakers voted to release testimony previously concealed for contradicting a hyperbolic narrative from the J6 Committee's star witness.

item.title: The Fiscal Hawks Never Win
item.description: All the latest drama on Capitol Hill is unlikely to fundamentally alter our dreadful fiscal trajectory.

item.title: Biden considers commuting the sentences of federal death row inmates: report
item.description: President Biden is reportedly considering commuting the sentences of most, if not all, of the 40 men on the federal government’s death row.

item.title: Senate approves 235th judge of Biden's term, beating Trump's tally
item.description: President Joe Biden secured the 235th judicial confirmation of his presidency Friday, an accomplishment that exceeds his predecessor's total by one af...

item.title: How Trump Can Make The Auto Industry Great Again
item.description: Some of the world’s largest automakers may not survive our government-created debacle, but collapse of the industry can still be stopped.

item.title: House passes revamped government funding extension hours before shutdown deadline
item.description: Republicans and Democrats coalesced around the GOP's revamped legislation to avert a partial government shutdown on Friday, hours ahead of the governm...

item.title: The 34 House Republicans who voted against a bill to avert a partial government shutdown
item.description: Thirty-four House Republicans voted Friday against a spending bill to avoid a partial government shutdown, while no Democrats opposed the legislation.

item.title: Dems Refused To Pass Kids Cancer Research Bill Until They Could Use It To Push 1,500 Pages Of Pork
item.description: In March the Republican-led House passed H.R. 3391, which would continue funding research of pediatric diseases like childhood cancer. The legislation...

item.title: Ivy League Faculties Fail The ‘Sodom And Gomorrah’ Test Of Having 10 Righteous Inhabitants
item.description: New universities will arise, and others that can meet the Sodom and Gomorrah test will reform themselves to offer an intellectually diverse and ideolo...

item.title: China Unsheathes Its Doomsday Artillery
item.description: Just how did China gain such dominance across the board in critical materials?

item.title: Online Dating’s Latest Innovation
item.description: Noninteraction.

item.title: Godard for Christmas
item.description: The controversial Hail Mary is more devout than controversial.

item.title: Millions Of Americans Will Do Anything For Their Kids’ Sports, Including Cutting Church
item.description: Travel sports has grown into a $39 billion dollar industry while churches are seeing a decrease in members and Sunday worshippers.

item.title: Missouri's near-total abortion ban is not enforceable, judge rules
item.description: A judge ruled Friday that Missouri's near-total abortion ban is unenforceable under a new constitutional amendment, ensuring abortion will be legal in...

item.title: Brief government shutdown ushered in before Christmas as Senate works to advance House bill
item.description: Congress did not manage to send a spending bill to President Biden's desk before the pre-Christmas deadline.

item.title: Senate passes bill to stop shutdown, sending it to President Biden's desk
item.description: Congress managed to pass a short-term spending bill through both chambers after going through three different versions of it.

item.title: House Republicans to take up government funding extension, defer debt limit vote until next year
item.description: House Republicans, with input from President-elect Donald Trump and his team, have agreed to move a temporary government funding extension and wait un...
